Class Planets

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.design.statePattern.StateMachine
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.adventurecards.cardstates.CardStateMachine
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.adventurecards.cards.Planets
All Implemented Interfaces:
AdventureCard, CargoReward, FlightDayPenalty, Participation<Cargo>, Penalty, Subject
public class Planets extends CardStateMachine implements AdventureCard, Participation<Cargo>, CargoReward, FlightDayPenalty
Represents the "Planets" adventure card in the game Galaxy Trucker.

This card allows multiple players to land on different planets to collect cargo rewards. Players choose in flight order which planet to land on, and each planet may be occupied by only one player. Once the planets are claimed, players take turns selecting cargo from their assigned planet.

  • Each player may choose to land on one of the available planets.
  • Planets are claimed in flight order and cannot be chosen by more than one player.
  • Each planet contains a list of Cargo items as rewards.
  • Players take turns choosing cargo from their planet, loading or discarding items.
  • Once all cargo is handled, each player who landed on a planet receives a flight day penalty.
The card operates as a Finite CLIViewState Machine (FSM) and progresses through the following states: 
 StartState
     ↓
 ParticipationState
     ↓
 CargoRewardState
     ↓
 FlightDayPenaltyState
     ↓
 EndState
Transitions are automatic and handled internally via updateState() and changeState().

Implementation Notes

  • Implements CargoReward to allow manual cargo selection and discarding per planet.
  • Implements FlightDayPenalty to apply movement penalties after rewards.
  • Only players who landed on a planet participate in the cargo phase and receive penalties.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Stefano Carletto

    • participate

      public void participate(Player player, int choice) throws InvalidActionException
      Allows the specified player to choose a planet, marking it as occupied.

      This method checks whether the selected planet is already occupied. If so, it throws an InvalidActionException. Otherwise, it marks the planet as occupied by the given player.

      Specified by:
      participate in interface Participation<Cargo>
      Parameters:
      player - the player attempting to occupy a planet
      choice - the planet the player wants to occupy
      Throws:
      InvalidActionException - if the selected planet is already occupied

    • getChoices

      public List<List<Cargo>> getChoices()
      Returns the list of available cargo rewards for each planet.

      Each element in the returned list corresponds to a planet and contains the set of Cargo items that can be obtained from that planet.

      Specified by:
      getChoices in interface Participation<Cargo>
      Returns:
      a list where each set represents the cargo rewards of a planet

      Returns the index of the planet currently occupied by the specified player.

      Parameters:
      targetPlayer - the player whose occupied planet is to be found
      Returns:
      the index of the planet occupied by the player
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is not occupying any planet
